title: 114_s1413
content: The Act is titled the "Higher Education Tax Benefit Compliance Improvement Act" and includes a waiver of penalties for certain failures related to information returns for higher education tuition and related expenses. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code exempts eligible educational institutions from penalties for not providing an individual's TIN on certain information returns related to higher education tuition. The amendment applies to returns filed after the enactment of the Act. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code requires taxpayers to receive a statement with the TIN of the individual for whom tuition expenses were paid to claim education tax credits. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code requires taxpayers to maintain a record of qualified tuition expenses if the educational institution does not provide a statement. Additionally, a conforming amendment allows a statement received by one individual to be treated as received by another taxpayer for tax credit purposes. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code requires taxpayers to receive a statement with the TIN of the individual to whom qualified tuition expenses were paid to claim a deduction. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code requires taxpayers to maintain a record of qualified tuition expenses if the educational institution does not provide a statement. The amendment to the Internal Revenue Code requires taxpayers to maintain a record of qualified tuition expenses if the educational institution does not provide a statement. The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after the date of the enactment of this Act.
